qas.question: There are two rows of 5 checkers each. A teddy accidentally spreads one row out. Are there more checkers in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 4 coins each. A puppy bumps one row and spreads it out. Are there more coins in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 6 buttons each. A child accidentally spreads one row. Are there more buttons in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 3 blocks each. A cat nudges one row and it spreads out. Are there more blocks in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 7 beads each. A teddy bumps one row and it spreads. Are there more beads in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 5 shells each. A baby pushes one row and it spreads out. Are there more shells in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 8 stars each. A child bumps one row and it spreads. Are there more stars in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 2 cups each. A dog bumps one row and it spreads. Are there more cups in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 9 stickers each. A kid accidentally spreads one row. Are there more stickers in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 10 pebbles each. A hand slips and spreads one row. Are there more pebbles in the spread-out row or the same number?
There are two rows of 1 button each. A breeze spreads one row. Are there more buttons in the spread-out row or the same number?
